body:
-[ ] give users a more intuitive understanding of how they can use their LLM, make it clear what they need to copy, and what they can do such as explore their preference that develop their preference set, or create sample ballots to share with their friends, making sure it's for the right jurisdiction. Right now those use cases are all the way at the bottom of the page and the copy buttons require a lot of scrolling. I think that the example prompts for your AI should include a note that there is additional context on this page such as the schema and users current preference set so the users LLM can ask for it if it doesn't have already. I'd like similar improvements along these lines
Safer Import Flow:
- [ ] The current import replaces all state (src/components/LLMIntegration.tsx:29–78). Add an optional “Preview Diff & Merge” step before applying.
- [ ] integrate diff components here to accept/reject per-topic changes.
- [x] Prompt Packs:
Expand the example prompts with parameterized templates (priorities, tone, topic count). Store as JSON to evolve over time and surface in the UI.
- [x] Schema Assistant:
When paste fails validation, show a human-friendly error explainer with links to the relevant schema docs (already embedded in LLMIntegration), and highlight the JSON field paths that failed.
title: Improved LLM Collaboration

body:
Imperative Toolbar Wiring: Multiple nodes are created and managed manually across files, which is brittle:
Static buttons wired in src/main.tsx:10–59
More buttons inserted dynamically in src/App.tsx:68–113
“Expand all” is re-wired with a clone hack in src/components/TopicList.tsx:39–58
Recommendation: Centralize toolbar into React (context or a top-level layout component) to avoid DOM mutations and inconsistent handlers.

Toolbar Density: On narrow screens the top toolbar will wrap and feels crowded.
Consolidate secondary actions into a “More” menu; keep 2–3 primary actions visible.
Sticky Action Bar: Add a bottom sticky bar with “New,” “Toggle View,” and “Export” on mobile to reduce scroll-to-top friction.
title: Clean up toolbar and DOM

- [ ] Defer expensive work (html2canvas, jsPDF) until user taps export; show a lightweight progress cue.
- [ ] Add Diff Preview prior to Import and LLM Import if template isn't empty:
Before clearAll()/clearBallot(), route pasted JSON to a diff preview and allow partial merges. Leverage existing diff components for consistency.
